maml:description.maml:para: Lists all of the inputs that are defined in a specified Stream Analytics job or gets information about a specific input.
The Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput cmdlet lists all of the inputs that are defined in a specified Stream Analytics job or gets information about a specific input.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics input belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics input belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics input belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics input belongs to.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns information about all the inputs defined on the job StreamingJob.
This command returns information about the input named EntryStream defined on the job StreamingJob.

maml:description.maml:para: Lists all Stream Analytics jobs defined in the Azure subscription or specified resource group or gets job information about a specific job within a resource group.

The Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob cmdlet lists all Stream Analytics jobs defined in the Azure subscription or specified resource group or gets job information about a specific job within a resource group.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to retrieve.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will retrieve the Azure Stream Analytics job, but not return information on its inputs, outputs, and transformation.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will retrieve the Azure Stream Analytics job, but not return information on its inputs, outputs, and transformation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to retrieve.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will retrieve the Azure Stream Analytics job, but not return information on its inputs, outputs, and transformation.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns information about all the Stream Analytics jobs in the Azure subscription.
This command returns information about all the Stream Analytics jobs in the resource group StreamAnalytics-Default-West-US.
This command returns information about the Stream Analytics job StreamingJob in the resource group StreamAnalytics-Default-West-US.

maml:description.maml:para: Lists all of the outputs that are defined in a specified Stream Analytics job or gets information about a specific output.
The Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput cmdlet lists all of the outputs that are defined in a specified Stream Analytics job or gets information about a specific output.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics output to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics output to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns information about the outputs defined on the job StreamingJob.
This command returns information about the output named Output defined on the job StreamingJob.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about the Streaming Unit quota of a specified region.
The Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsQuota cmdlet gets information about the Streaming Unit quota of a specified region.

Specifies the name of an Azure region/Azure data center location to get Streaming Unit quota information for. See http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/regions/#services for a list of supported Azure regions.

Specifies the name of an Azure region/Azure data center location to get Streaming Unit quota information for. See http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/regions/#services for a list of supported Azure regions.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns information about Streaming Unit quota and usage in the West US region.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about a specific transformation defined on Stream Analytics job.
The Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsTransformation cmdlet gets information about a specific transformation defined on Stream Analytics job.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics transformation belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics transformation to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics transformation belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics transformation belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics transformation to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics transformation belongs to.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns information about the transformation called StreamingJob on the job StreamingJob.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new input within a Stream Analytics job or updates an existing specified input. The name of the input can be specified in the .JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must be the same with the one in the file. If you specify an input that already exists and do not specify -Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing input. If you specify -Force parameter and specify an existing input name, the input will be replaced without confirmation.

The New-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput cmdlet creates a new input within a Stream Analytics job or updates an existing specified input. The name of the input can be specified in the .JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must be the same with the one in the file. If you specify an input that already exists and do not specify -Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing input. If you specify -Force parameter and specify an existing input name, the input will be replaced without confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the Azure Stream Analytics input should be created under.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to create.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics input to create.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will replace the specified Azure Stream Analytics input if it already exists without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Streaming input should be created under.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the Azure Stream Analytics input should be created under.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to create.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics input to create.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will replace the specified Azure Stream Analytics input if it already exists without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Streaming input should be created under.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new input from the file Input.json. If an existing input with the name specified in the input definition file is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.
This command creates a new input on the job called EntryStream. If an existing input with this name is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.
This command replaces the definition of the existing input source called EntryStream with the definition from file.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure or updates the definition of an existing specified job. The name of the job can be specified in the .JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must be the same with the one in the file. If you specify a job name that already exists and do not specify -Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing job. If you specify -Force parameter and specify an existing job name, the job definition will be replaced without confirmation.

The New-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob cmdlet creates a new Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure or updates the definition of an existing specified job. The name of the job can be specified in the .JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must be the same with the one in the file. If you specify a job name that already exists and do not specify -Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing job. If you specify -Force parameter and specify an existing job name, the job definition will be replaced without confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to create.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics job to create.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will replace the specified Azure Stream Analytics job if it already exists without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics job should be created under.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to create.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics job to create.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will replace the specified Azure Stream Analytics job if it already exists without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics job should be created under.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new job from the definition in JobDefinition.json. If an existing job with the name specified in the job definition file is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.
This command replaces the job definition for StreamingJob.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new output within a Stream Analytics job or updates an existing output. The name of the output can be specified in the .JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must be the same with the one in the file. If you specify an output that already exists and do not specify -Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing output. If you specify -Force parameter and specify an existing output name, the output will be replaced without confirmation.

The New-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput cmdlet creates a new output within a Stream Analytics job or updates an existing output. The name of the output can be specified in the .JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must be the same with the one in the file. If you specify an output that already exists and do not specify -Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing output. If you specify -Force parameter and specify an existing output name, the output will be replaced without confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the Azure Stream Analytics output should be created under.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics output to create.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics output to create.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will replace the specified Azure Stream Analytics output if it already exists without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics output should be created under.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the Azure Stream Analytics output should be created under.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics output to create.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics output to create.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will replace the specified Azure Stream Analytics output if it already exists without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics output should be created under.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new output called "output" in the job StreamingJob. If an existing output with this name is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.
This command replaces the definition for "output" in the job StreamingJob.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new transformation within a Stream Analytics job or updates the existing transformation. The name of the transformation can be specified in the .JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must be the same with the one in the file. If you specify a transformation that already exists and do not specify -Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing transformation. If you specify -Force parameter and specify an existing transformation name, the transformation will be replaced without confirmation.

The New-AzureStreamAnalyticsTransformation cmdlet creates a new transformation within a Stream Analytics job or updates the existing transformation. The name of the transformation can be specified in the .JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must be the same with the one in the file. If you specify a transformation that already exists and do not specify -Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing transformation. If you specify -Force parameter and specify an existing transformation name, the transformation will be replaced without confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the Azure Stream Analytics transformation should be created under.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics transformation to create.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics transformation to create.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will replace the specified Azure Stream Analytics transformation if it already exists without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics transformation should be created under.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the Azure Stream Analytics transformation should be created under.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics transformation to create.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics transformation to create.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will replace the specified Azure Stream Analytics transformation if it already exists without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics transformation should be created under.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new transformation called StreamingJobTransform in the job StreamingJob. If an existing transformation is already defined with this name, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.
This command replaces the definition of StreamingJobTransform in the job StreamingJob.

maml:description.maml:para: Asynchronously deletes a specific input from a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure. If you specify -Force parameter the input will be deleted without confirmation.

The Remove-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput cmdlet asynchronously deletes a specific input from a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure. If you specify -Force parameter the input will be deleted without confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics input belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to remove.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will delete the specified Azure Stream Analytics input without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics input belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics input belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to remove.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will delete the specified Azure Stream Analytics input without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics input belongs to.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the input EventStream from StreamingJob

maml:description.maml:para: Asynchronously deletes a specific Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure. If you specify -Force parameter the job will be deleted without confirmation.
The Remove-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob cmdlet asynchronously deletes a specific Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure. If you specify -Force parameter the job will be deleted without confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to remove.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will delete the specified Azure Stream Analytics job without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to remove.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will delete the specified Azure Stream Analytics job without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs to.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the job StreamingJob.

maml:description.maml:para: Asynchronously deletes a specific output from a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure. If you specify -Force parameter the output will be deleted without confirmation.

The Remove-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput cmdlet asynchronously deletes a specific output from a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure. If you specify -Force parameter the output will be deleted without confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics output to remove.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will delete the specified Azure Stream Analytics output without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics output to remove.
If this parameter is specified, the cmdlet will delete the specified Azure Stream Analytics output without asking for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the output Output in the job StreamingJob.

maml:description.maml:para: Asynchronously deploys and starts a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.
The Start-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob cmdlet asynchronously deploys and starts a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to start.

Value may be JobStartTime, CustomTime, or LastOutputEventTime to indicate whether the starting point of the output event stream should either start whenever the job is started, start at a custom user time stamp specified via the outputStartTime property, or start from the last event output time. If the property is absent, the default is JobStartTime.

Value is either an ISO-8601 formatted time stamp that indicates the starting point of the output event stream, or null to indicate that the output event stream will start whenever the streaming job is started. This property must have a value if outputStartMode is set to CustomTime.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to start.

Value may be JobStartTime, CustomTime, or LastOutputEventTime to indicate whether the starting point of the output event stream should either start whenever the job is started, start at a custom user time stamp specified via the outputStartTime property, or start from the last event output time. If the property is absent, the default is JobStartTime.

Value is either an ISO-8601 formatted time stamp that indicates the starting point of the output event stream, or null to indicate that the output event stream will start whenever the streaming job is started. This property must have a value if outputStartMode is set to CustomTime.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs to.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts the job StreamingJob and specifies that the output event stream should start at timestamp 2014-07-03T01:00Z.

maml:description.maml:para: Asynchronously stops a Stream Analytics job from running in Microsoft Azure and de-allocates resources that were that were being used. The job definition and meta-data will remain available within your subscription through both the Azure Portal and Management APIs, such that the job can be edited and restarted. You will not be charged for a job in the Stopped state.

The Stop-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob cmdlet asynchronously stops a Stream Analytics job from running in Microsoft Azure and de-allocates resources that were that were being used. The job definition and meta-data will remain available within your subscription through both the Azure Portal and Management APIs, such that the job can be edited and restarted. You will not be charged for a job in the Stopped state.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to stop.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to stop.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs to.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command stops the job StreamingJob.

maml:description.maml:para: Tests the ability of Stream Analytics to connect to a specified input.
The Test-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput cmdlet tests the ability of Stream Analytics to connect to a specified input.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics input belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to test.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics input belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to test.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This tests the connection status of the input EntryStream in StreamingJob.

maml:description.maml:para: Tests the ability of Stream Analytics to connect to a specified output.
The Test-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput cmdlet tests the ability of Stream Analytics to connect to a specified output.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics output to test.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job that the desired Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics output to test.
Specifies the name of the resource group that the Azure Stream Analytics output belongs to.
Not Specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: This tests the connection status of the output Output in StreamingJob.
